headline: Digital Supply Chain & Logistics Tech Research Report 2026: A $146.92 Billion Market by 2031 from $72 Billion in 2025 with SAP, Oracle, Blue Yonder, DHL, and Schneider Electric Leading
summary: The Digital Supply Chain & Logistics Tech Market is anticipated to grow from USD 72 Billion in 2025 to USD 146.92 Billion by 2031, at a CAGR of 12.62%. Key trends driving this growth include advancements in robotics and warehouse automation, such as Amazon's Vulcan, and the rise of collaborative logistics networks, illustrated by Bosch’s Supply Chain Studio. headline: Oracle Corp (ORCL)’s Upside Potential: Federal Wins and Market Confidence
summary: Oracle Corp (NYSE:ORCL) is among the best S&P 500 stocks with highest upside potential. The company has won a contract to help the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) modernize its systems. This deal was announced on February 11, and it involves provision of cloud services to support the federal health agency’s mission-critical systems. […]

headline: Stock Pickers See Their Moment to Shine in Market’s AI Freak-Out
summary: Yes, artificial intelligence is likely to disrupt companies and put some of them out of business.  When a new AI tool threatens to upset an industry, investors are simply selling the whole group.  “We’re having a shakeout, but it’s a good buying opportunity,” said Gina Bolvin Bernarduci, president at Bolvin Wealth Management Group, who says she’s snapping up tech shares after valuations for the group have retreated.

content.title: Stock Pickers See Their Moment to Shine in Market’s AI Freak-Out
content.summary: Yes, artificial intelligence is likely to disrupt companies and put some of them out of business.  When a new AI tool threatens to upset an industry, investors are simply selling the whole group.  “We’re having a shakeout, but it’s a good buying opportunity,” said Gina Bolvin Bernarduci, president at Bolvin Wealth Management Group, who says she’s snapping up tech shares after valuations for the group have retreated.
